item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 5, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Guten: A Tiny Newspaper Printer (59 points | 22 comments)
2. No more needles Tracking blood sugar on your wrist (109 points | 39 comments)
3. Combining 15s interval whole-sky-camera photos to form a 4y spanning keogram (399 points | 62 comments)
4. University of Alabama Engineer Pioneers New Process for Recycling Plastics (2024) (91 points | 71 comments)
5. ELKS: Linux for 16-bit Intel Processors (130 points | 56 comments)
6. Blur Busters Open Source Display Initiative – Refresh Cycle Shaders (7 points | discuss)
7. Hacker gains access to the RP2350 OTP secret by glitching the RISC-V cores (18 points | 1 comment)
8. How to draw an outline in a video game (447 points | 52 comments)
9. Refurb Weekend: Atari Stacy (12 points | discuss)
10. One Dog vs. the Windows 3.1 Graphics Stack (184 points | 69 comments)
11. Show HN: WebGPU + TypeScript Slime Mold (44 points | 6 comments)
12. Self driving 1993 Volvo with open pilot (559 points | 126 comments)
13. The comb jelly can fuse with another (including nervous and digestive systems) (35 points | 6 comments)
14. Labwc: Wlroots-based window-stacking compositor for Wayland, inspired by openbox (39 points | 8 comments)
15. It Matters Who Owns Your Copylefted Copyrights (2021) (80 points | 86 comments)
16. Hornet, RNA structure visualization method correlates sequence and 3D topology (6 points | 1 comment)
17. PyPI Blog: Project Quarantine (54 points | 6 comments)
18. No-hole surgery: no keyhole, yet surgeons can now still operate under your skin (45 points | 10 comments)
19. Hacking yourself a satellite – recovering BEESAT-1 [video] (136 points | 7 comments)
20. A Return to Polymathy (2015) [pdf] (119 points | 55 comments)
21. GPON FTTH networks (in)security (2016) (3 points | discuss)
22. Phase behavior of Cacio and Pepe sauce (340 points | 168 comments)
23. Meta is killing off its AI-powered Instagram and Facebook profiles (322 points | 448 comments)
24. Ask HN: How are you using LLMs for traversing decompiler output? (88 points | 39 comments)
25. Myst Markdown – Markdown for technical/scientific document (20 points | 5 comments)
26. The DIY Multideck (112 points | 44 comments)
27. Show HN: Open Rewind – POC for audio and screen and video streaming to S3 (70 points | 25 comments)
28. Show HN: Pretty-print your chess games using Prettier (82 points | 8 comments)
29. Web page annoyances that I don't inflict on you here (150 points | 40 comments)
30. Show HN: I created a PoC for live descriptions of the surroundings for the blind (33 points | 7 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 5, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
